3.author: Hedgehog797
3.body:
Starwarsprofilepic:
"piston dooor would be overcomplicated, but thanks for the suggestion."
  

Your response:
"Don't be hating on someone not wanting to use redstone. It's intimidating to someone who doesn't touch redstone, and it's obviously not what they have in mind for their build"
  
If you don't think it's complicated your response doesn't make sense

3.author: Gellzer
3.body: You need to think that I think it's complicated to understand why I think you shouldn't hate on someone? Could you explain that to me, because THAT'S what doesn't make sense

3.author: Hedgehog797
3.body:
They're being downvoted because they said it's "overcomplicated". They didn't say it doesn't fit the build.
You disagree with the downvotes, so it stands to reason you agree with their statement.

3.author: Gellzer
3.body: Yeah, they're wanting to do something that doesn't at all involve redstone. At all, not "simplistic redstone". No redstone at all. I 100% agree they should be allowed to build how they please. I think someone shouldn't receive hate because they don't want to involve redstone, I fail to see how this is a controversial statement, much less your problem with understanding that point

3.author: Hedgehog797
3.body: Let me try to say this as simply as possible. If the issue is using redstone, they should have said  'I won't use redstone in this build',  not  "It's overcomplicated". They are downvoted because they said something that isn't true. They are not being downvoted because they aren't using redstone.

3.author: Gellzer
3.body: What if all their builds don't involve any redstone at all? What if they want to avoid it completely? What if everything they build is super simple? Then adding redstone to their simplistic building style absolutely is over complicated to their non-redstone way of building. You're only looking at it from your own perspective and being incredibly judgemental of others' perspectives

3.author: Hedgehog797
3.body: Buddy, if you're considering disliking someone saying objectively false things as judging, you're gonna have a bad time

3.author: Gellzer
3.body: It's not objectively false, see that's your problem. If you go around subjecting people to your understanding of things, you're gonna have a really bad time learning how to communicate with people. People with learning disabilities, people who are young, people who are old, people who simply don't want to learn redstone, all can struggle with redstone. Especially people with learning disabilities. But you can only see the world through your own eyes, and you'd rather belittle people with passive aggressive words like "you're gonna have a bad time" instead of shifting your paradigm

9.author: blankettripod32_v2
9.body:
That sounds about right, Check your Minecraft settings for the following

Frame limit is set to your monitors refresh rate + 15
Render distance at 16 or more (for a quick test)
Simulation distance < render distance

This should use your gpu more, if the frame rate stays at whatever it is at, then we have a bigger problem, if it goes down, then we have a problem that is easier to solve

9.author: PabloFP64
9.body: Yep, now its 600ish Mb/s, and framerate is at 1-5

9.author: blankettripod32_v2
9.body: If when the allocation rate goes down it is still 5-10, then install an older version of Minecraft, try 1.18 vanilla and see if the issue persists

9.author: blankettripod32_v2
9.body: This sounds like a problem With the pc then, try restarting your computer first

9.author: blankettripod32_v2
9.body:
Well unfortunately this sounds like something outside my level of experience. But I wish you the best of luck.

My final piece of advice is try reinstalling java, preferring the latest version, (JDK 19) and uninstall java 17

Sorry I can't help, hope you find a solution!

Edit: just had a thought are the beds all centered around the centre of the farm? It needs to create a village centre for the spawning mechanism to work and this is the easiest way to do that from what I understand

13.author: MasterJayShay
13.body: Yeah I just checked. Completely solid below the surface.

13.author: MasterJayShay
13.body: All the beds are directly under the villagers, basically. Like a layered cake. I just got it working again but all I really did was give them more beds and more stations so now I have 23 villagers and a working farm again.

13.author: Red_77_Dragon
13.body: Cool design, definitely different! I'm glad you got it working again, im thinking one of your villagers wasn't happy with their workstation or bed and by adding more it sorted itself out. 🙂

13.author: MasterJayShay
13.body: Thanks! I copied it from a video I saw but I think the swamp area helps to make it look neat. Plus I don't have to worry about underground caves interfering with the golem spawn because the land I used to make the farm is essentially a giant floating bowl so there's nowhere else for them to spawn under it.

20.author: Wolf68k
20.body:
Set the instance to have a different Game folder separate from the default .minecraft folder.

Click Installations. Select the instance, then the 3 dots followed by Edit.

I forget if you have to click More Options or not. You should see Game Folder and browse to a folder. What I do, before that is find a place to put and create the folder.I went with Documents, created Minecraft, created folder for instance. In this case it might be Documents\Minecraft\1.5.2\

Try the instance. Whatever it needs will be created there.

The official launcher installs and uses its own versions of Java based one what MC version you're playing.

Failing that and since you installed Java 8 (Java 7 isn't really used any more), try using MultiMC. You'll want Java 17 as well if you want to use MultiMC for game versions from 1.17.x and up. Java 8 is for 1.16.5 and older. With MultiMC each instance can have a different Java version than what you set in the main Settings as the global.

20.author: Mashsim
20.body: I tried everything, even with MultiMC. I already had Java 17 installed, but nothing changes, it doesn't load over the Mojang logo. :\\

20.author: Mashsim
20.body:
This is the last part of the crash error after shutting it down from the task manager:  


`Jan 26, 2023 11:15:59 PM net.java.games.input.DefaultControllerEnvironment getControllers`  
`WARNING: Found unknown Windows version: Windows 8`  
`Jan 26, 2023 11:15:59 PM net.java.games.input.DefaultControllerEnvironment getControllers`  
`INFO: Attempting to use default windows plug-in.`  
`Jan 26, 2023 11:15:59 PM net.java.games.input.DefaultControllerEnvironment getControllers`  
`INFO: Loading: net.java.games.input.DirectAndRawInputEnvironmentPlugin`  
`Process exited with code 1 (0x1).`  
`Please note that usually neither the exit code, nor its description are enough to diagnose issues!`  
`Always upload the entire log and not just the exit code.`

20.author: Wolf68k
20.body:
This only happens with 1.5.2? And with MMC you were using Java 8 for it.

In MMC edit the instance, on the Minecraft Log tab, click Upload and follow the steps. If all goes well, paste the link. Paste.ee has been flaky lately, if so click Copy then go to Pastebin.com and paste it there and share the link.

If you're using MMC the others ad well, remember to make sure they are set to use Java 8. Other wise I would need to see that log I talked about to see what is going on. MultiMC also has a Discord and they will ask for the log as well.

35.author: Amethystea
35.body:
If you are going to use the Education Edition, there is a plethora of information about it here:  
[https://educommunity.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/categories/360003796971-Get-Set-Up](https://educommunity.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/categories/360003796971-Get-Set-Up)  


All players need to be running the same version of Minecraft: Education Edition to be able to host and join worlds together. Server-style multiplayer is not possible and a sever license is not available.  


Now, if you plan to use the standard edition, you certainly will need a paid version for each user. Minecraft Pocket Edition can only do multiplayer via the online realms and direct connection via LAN.  It supports a max of 5 players, by default, but you can change this using the /setmaxplayers command in-game. Note that performance will be impacted for each additional player.

35.author: puddelles
35.body: Follow up question, how do i type the command? /setmaxplayers <8> ?

35.author: Amethystea
35.body:
select the 'Chat' button to open the 'Chat box' and type in the command that you want to use.

/setmaxplayers 8

the "<>" are often used to denote a variable, so you wouldn't include those in the actual command.

35.author: Amethystea
35.body: You're welcome.  I hope you and the students have fun!

37.author: ASIK-1952
37.body:
Actually, yes because if a mob dies and a charge is detected more than 4 blocks away from the sculk catalyst, a sculk block has a chance to use 10 experience to grow a sculk sensor or a sculk shrieker.
A sculk sensor has a chance of 9% spawning, whereas a sculk shrieker has of 1%.

However, a sculk catalyst cannot spawn sculk sensors or sculk shriekers if there are 2 or more sensors w/in a 9x3x9 box w/ the centre (of the box) centered on the bubbling charge location or w/in -4,0,-4, and 4,2,4 in relative coordinates.

Edit: Sculk shriekers spawned through sculk catalyst cannot spawn a warden since as others have already mentioned that a sculk shrieker has to be made during world generation to spawn a warden.

37.author: TreyLastname
37.body: Actually no. They can spawn shreikers and sensors, but the shriekers can't summon a warden, has to be one made during world generation

37.author: ASIK-1952
37.body: Oh, okay, didn't knew that. Thanks!

39.author: _BubbleCat_
39.body:
Excuse me, I didn't force anyone to like it. I just had an opinion about it and felt like its a good game. And it's a game. It's not that deep. It didn't discriminate or committed anything against anyone so I hardly think it "wronged" anybody. It just has a few bugs and isn't as advanced as Java which is expected if you are  attempting to shove a game like minecraft into a mobile port. 

Futher more, all I said is I MYSELF don't believe it need such hate. I didn't go. "HOW DARE YOU HATE IT. THAT IS ABSOLUTELY WRONG." I know alot of people love doing that, but that's not what I intended. If you don't like it then that's great! If you like it that's also great! That's your opinion. Common sense should tell you that you don't have to agree with me.

Lastly, I don't think you've read the whole thing my friend, because in the end I said, everyone likes different versions of minecraft and I think that a game that can manage that has done something right and is pretty amazing. :]

48.author: Wolf68k
48.body:
First one, can't locate Java runtime, is easy using 2-ish methods.

First is to go to the path as shown and see if the javaw.exe is actually there or not. It's not showing the full path, so I might be missing something. The path should be like this C:\\Users\\*USERNAME*\\AppData\\Local\\Packages\\Microsoft.4297127D64EC6\_8wekyb3d8bbwe\\LocalCache\\Local\\runtime\\java-runtime-gamma\\windows-x64\\java-runtime-gamma\\bin\\javaw.exe If you find it, good. Why the launcher can't I don't know.

The second method is to download and install Java 17 yourself. For that go here [https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/javase/jdk17-archive-downloads.html](https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/javase/jdk17-archive-downloads.html) After installing Java and you're not sure where it was installed; go to Start and type **cmd** and select Command Prompt and type **echo %java\_home%** then when you go there, look in the bin folder and you'll find the javaw.exe you'll need in the next part.

The next part is the same for both methods. In the launcher click on Installations. Select the one you want to use, or are having problems with. Click the 3-dots followed by Edit. Click More Options. Look for Java Executable and click Browse. Navigate to where the javaw.exe is you want to use. Click Save and try playing the instance.

​

As for the missing .ogg file, I'm not 100% what to do there but here is what I would try. Make sure the launcher is not running. Go the the .minecraft folder (C:\\Users\\*USERNAME*\\AppData\\Roaming\\.minecraft) and rename it (suggestion: .minecraft-mine or -old). Open the launcher again and try to run the default instance, even if it isn't the one you want. Then try creating the MC version you want and test that. Yes you will lose the profiles you created and anything else you've added, but remember they are in the renamed folder. You can copy worlds, resource packs and datapacks over to the new folder. The profiles you'll be best to recreate instead of copying them over...that and I don't really know the perfect steps to that but they aren't that big of a deal to redo.

48.author: Wolf68k
48.body: You could also use third-party launchers like MultiMC, which requires you to install Java. MultiMC also has a better logging system. If you've ever gotten, or seen, the Exit 1 errors, with the official launcher its a guessing game why, where as with MultiMC you'll have a log that gives you a lot more information and possibly a direct answer why.

54.author: DawnfireRose
54.body: I'd guess that one of the two villagers has items in its inventory that it shouldn't. The farmer could have slots too full of seeds to pick up potatoes at all. But you'd eventually see wheat or beetroot growing if that were the case. More likely, the other villager already has enough food items, so the farmer doesn't think it's necessary to share.

54.author: kingviper186
54.body: Ok how could I get the other villager to drop the stuff or do I need a new one

54.author: DawnfireRose
54.body:
It's not practical to do it without getting another villager involved. 

About the original villager: Some food will be eaten if the villager becomes willing to breed (and based on what the wiki says, I don't think actual breeding is required), but there could potentially be a lot in its inventory, so that would take a while to actually work. You could speed it up by having it toss some food to another villager, but at that point you may as well just put the new villager in the farm and remove the old one. 

For getting a new villager: a new baby is probably best, since you want to know if any other villager tosses food before you can move it into place in the farm.

55.author: markgatty
55.body:
The Xbox one edition was a C++ port of the java code (I think) and was not good enough to have on other platforms such as mobile. So they changed it up a fair bit to what bedrock is today which allows the same game to be played on many different paltforms.

Java on the other hand has never gone through such major changes so it was never discontinued like the old console version.

68.author: Paradigm_Reset
68.body: Are you talking about Bedrock or Java?

68.author: thearcticworier
68.body: java sorry i should have specified in the post

68.author: Paradigm_Reset
68.body: Ah, then it doesn't matter...you can use commands to give yourself Java Achievements.  They ain't like Bedrock Advancements.

68.author: thearcticworier
68.body:
so I can just enable commands in the world and still be able to get achievements by default? I'm not doing this to give myself anything as I'm easily capable of doing that stuff myself but I just want to tp places and was wondering if I could. 

what about bedrock in that case? would advancements/achievements be disabled forever?

68.author: Paradigm_Reset
68.body:
Cheats/commands/etc have zero impact on Java Achievements.  They can be given to the player with commands.  They refresh with every new world.  You can create custom ones (many mods do).  

Bedrock Advancements are tied to the player's account, they carry over to every world you play.  You cannot have any sort of cheats/commands turned on and get Bedrock Achievements.  You cannot alter them.

68.author: thearcticworier
68.body:
I see, so ginish bedrock 100% first and then mess around with cheats. Got it

Thank you very much, you've been a huge help. I'm telling you searching for this stuff shows you nothing useful

71.author: quatre185
71.body:
Ok, maybe it's not as complicated as I thought...  
  
**Outposts**  
  
Pillagers continually spawn in a 72×54×72 block volume centered on the top floor in a pillager outpost. Some pillagers spawn as outpost captains. They may spawn on any valid opaque block if the block light level is less than or equal to 8.  
  
In Java Edition, there can be unlimited pillagers that spawn in outposts naturally, limited only by the natural spawning rules.  
  
In Bedrock Edition, pillagers continually spawn at or below a particular location in the outpost, choosing the highest opaque block with a non-solid block on top and spawning on the northwest corner. A maximum of eight pillagers spawn naturally in an outpost.
